thread.title: Heterosexual Couple Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld Lose Civil Partnership Case
thread.title_full: Heterosexual Couple Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld Lose Civil Partnership Case

author: Sarah Ann Harris
title: Heterosexual Couple Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld Lose Civil Partnership Case
text: Heterosexual Couple Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld Lose Civil Partnership Case They do not wish to get married. 21/02/2017 09:56 | Updated 1 minute ago Sarah Ann Harris News Reporter, The Huffington Post UK Heterosexual couple Rebecca Steinfeld and Charles Keidan have lost their Court of Appeal battle for the right to enter into a civil partnership. Rebecca Steinfeld and Charles Keidan have said that they wish to have a civil partnership, rather than a marriage , because they believe it “captures the essence of our relationship and values”. They lost their case by two votes to one in the Court of Appeal on Tuesday. Nick Ansell/PA Wire Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld have lost their appeal to enter a civil partnership The couple, who are academics and live in Hammersmith, west London, have argued that the Government’s position on civil partnerships is “incompatible with equality law”. Speaking outside the court following the verdict, Keidan said that unless they heard from the government on the issue, the couple would go on to challenge the ruling in the Supreme Court. He added: “None of us should be denied recognition or protection because marriage isn’t right for us.” Steinfeld and Keidan have been in a relationship for six years and have a 20-month-old daughter together. This is a breaking news story and will be updated. Check back for the fullest version. Follow The Huffington Post UK on Twitter here , and on Facebook here . More:
